H0.text: A supply of stored food is what seeds have that spores do not.

H1.text: DNA is present in seeds but not in spores.

H2.text: Pollenators are what seeds have that spores do not.

H3.text: Chlorophyll is found in seeds but not in spores.

A4.text: In some groups (e.g. grains of the family Poaceae), the endosperm persists to the mature seed stage as a storage tissue

A5.text: It is triploid (meaning three chromosome sets per nucleus)

A6.text: The cotyledons contain the stored food reserves of the seed.

A7.text: Cotyledons may turn green and begin photosynthesis.
